website_summaries.verdict: With a longer pole than most Greenworks models and a surprising amount of power for a cordless model, this unit gets high marks for both its reach and its ability to handle larger jobs.
pros: Pole extends to 9 feet, farther reach than many electric Greenworks pole saws
Not only does this model have the longest reach, but it can handle the biggest jobs, too
The powerful 80-volt motor can cut through limbs of moderate-to-thick size, and can chop logs of the same size
The extended 10-inch chain on this model gives it even more cutting power
Stands out for its unusual ability to offer the mobility of a cordless unit with this much power
cons: At just over 12 pounds, this model weighs more than most others, and some users may find it difficult to maneuver

customer_reviews.title: Bad Pole Saw worse company
customer_reviews.text: Pole Saw broke in half after it's second use. It looks like they used cheap pot metal to manufacture the clamps that hold the hole thing together. Whats worse is they do not return emails and their phone line is constantly busy. Now I have a brand new tool that is unusable and cannot be returned despite the advertised 4 year warranty.
customer_reviews.author: Mikey62

customer_reviews.title: This makes a much better combo, and gives you access to all of ...
customer_reviews.text: This pole saw is too too heavy. The motor is located in the saw head, which puts a lot of weight at the top of the pole. Instead of buying this, get the Greenworks 80v string trimmer that is “attachments capable”. Then buy the Ryobi pole saw attachment, all Ryobi string trimmer attachments are compatible with the Greenworks 80v “attachments capable” string trimmer. This makes a much better combo, and gives you access to all of the Ryobi attachments.
customer_reviews.author: Real Reviewer

customer_reviews.title: Useful tool
customer_reviews.text: I agree completely with the positive reviews. Cuts fast through 6 inch limbs, plenty of torque. Super quiet. Trimmed up all the fruit trees in my yard in no time. Cleaning the branches took longer than cutting. Great product. Assembly was simple and took all of 2 minutes but getting the pole to pole nub in was a bit difficult. I'd certainly recommend this product. Well balanced, but a little heavy over time. The hook helps pull branches stuck in the tree. Uses standard bar oil, 1 reservoir per charge. No need for a ladder any more.
customer_reviews.author: Kenneth Hill

customer_reviews.title: power, longevity on battery all there
customer_reviews.text: Used once to prune multiple trees, The battery lasted the entire time and had 2 out of three bars left when I was done. I cut effortlessly dead limbs up to 8 inches in diameter. Very impressed with the power and performance.
customer_reviews.author: Cravnspeed

customer_reviews.title: Great for all the trimming around the home and fence areas! Great product...
customer_reviews.text: This chainsaw is perfect for the homeowner who has trees like me growing up over the house and fence around their yard. Very easy to use and cut though 1-4 in limbs well. You will need to buy some chain oil put in before using but can get that anywhere or on Amazon when you buy. Oil does drip a small amount from the saw blade so be aware of your walks and porch area may need a little clean up, but not bad. Also keep an eye on the clear oil container that you keep oil in there to lube the blade when in use.
customer_reviews.author: Brian Hobock

customer_reviews.title: Beware of Amazon sending the wrong replacement chain
customer_reviews.text: Powerful saw, with good battery life. The main problem is that Greenworks makes multiple pole saws with 10" chains. They are not interchangeable. And Amazon recommends the wrong chains in the suggestion box. When you get a replacement chain you need to read VERY carefully to make sure you have the right ones. I bought replacement chains with it, and by the time I needed one the Amazon return window was closed.
customer_reviews.author: J. M. Richardson

customer_reviews.title: Worked great for one day.
customer_reviews.text: This worked great the day I used it last year. I was pleasantly surprised. Went to get it out this week and now it's dead. Charger flashing red, saw is d.o.a. I abandoned all hope of speaking to someone at the "customer assistance" line after 15 minutes of waiting for someone to even answer. Update: Today they're closed all together for the holiday - Good Friday)I think I bought the protection plan, will try that avenue. Bottom line: worked great for one day. Squaretrade won't help because it's still in the manufacturer warranty period.
customer_reviews.author: Prime Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great pole saw!
customer_reviews.text: This saw cuts through limbs like a knife through butter and you will wear out before the battery runs out of charge. UPDATE: One BIG problem with this saw! Can't find a replacement chain anywhere! If anybody has found one please tell me where! Greenworks is no help. They give you an Oregon part number that dosen'T exist as far as I can tell!
customer_reviews.author: Way over 40 Pirate

customer_reviews.title: Good saw...wastes chain oil...A LOT of chain oil
customer_reviews.text: The pole saw is great. Two problems - it spits chain bar oil like crazy...you have to replace the oil about every 10 minutes...it’s ridiculous. You can see a mist cloud of oil while using the saw. The other issue is finding a replacement chain...for some reason Greenworks makes it a mystery.
customer_reviews.author: E. Morris

customer_reviews.title: Excellent - set up carefully
customer_reviews.text: Use it briefly and then set up the blade very carefully. Keep trying until it cuts well with the chain tight on the blade. Keep trying. Once it is set up, check the tension each time to make sure it is still tight. - It must have oil - When taking down large branches, do not try to cut underneath first. Just go in three phases. Quick and powerful for the first half. Much more careful as you continue and watch for the branch to begin to collapse. - Then really careful with little snips until it is down. The usual precautions must be taken for falling branches: headgear, gloves, stand in the right place, etc.
customer_reviews.author: Laurence Matson

customer_reviews.title: Cuts like a Boss!
customer_reviews.text: Cuts great. Super quiet. Wish the pole was telescoping. Trimmed up all the trees in my yard in no time. Cleaning the branches took longer than cutting. Great product. Assembly was simple and took all of 2 minutes but getting the pole to pole nub in was a bit difficult. I'd certainly recommend this product. I bought a second battery to go with this.
customer_reviews.author: T. Whittaker

customer_reviews.title: Love this thing
customer_reviews.text: Would give this 5 stars if length was adjustable. Love this thing! So easy to use, makes limbing trees fun. Love that saw turns off when you are moving, simply pull trigger when you need it to run, off when you don't. Cuts large limbs like butter! Used this saw to buck my trees before I fell them with my regular chainsaw. This thing is quieter than gas saw and just plain works great. No more mixing fuel. Just grab battery and go. Love it.
customer_reviews.author: zannsu

customer_reviews.title: I'm not impressed with this product
customer_reviews.text: I watched the videos and it works nothing like what is in the video. I know that one wrong move can dull the chain, however from the beginning the saw could not cut the 5 inch pieces of brush I was trying to cut up. I moved on to a high branch that was about 4 inches and it took forever to cut through it. Needless to say it took about 10 times longer due to the chain coming off all of time. For me I would rather go back to a gas powered saw, were you have more control over the tightening the chain, etc. I love my other Greenworks products, just not this one.
customer_reviews.author: Raymond D Jennings Jr

customer_reviews.title: 80v definitely better than 40v
customer_reviews.text: Great power and duration of battery. The 80v really adds to the cutting power much better than 40v. The only drawback is that the pole length. Others i have used have a telescoping pole which you can be lengthened or shortened which adds a lot of maneuverability. This saw has more reach but the pole is fixed and there is no way to shorten it, its approx 11 ft long ALWAYS.
customer_reviews.author: mario r. barrera

customer_reviews.title: This saw cuts through 6" dead Oak branches like butter...no kidding. Chain stays sharp a surprising long time.
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this saw to limb several 40 foot Pine trees and two 50 year old Oak trees with large dead branches. I were out long before the saw's battery is even ready for a recharge. After several uses, I located a backup chain for the saw on eBay and sharpened the original chain. Excellent product. After my neighbor tried my saw, he ordered his own so he could his trees, even after I offered him to loan him my saw.
customer_reviews.author: William Dye

customer_reviews.title: Great Product
customer_reviews.text: Love this product BUT BEWARE Do NOT buy the Frequently bought together Chain Oil and Replacement Chain. THe replacement chain was for a chain saw NOT the POLE saw. Very frustrating. The right item number for replacement chain is Greenworks 2937002 10" Replacement Chain the chain they sent was Greenworks 10-Inch Replacement Chainsaw Chain 29052. The company needs to correct that error. It cost us time and money to not have the right replacement when we needed it. Bummer. But we DO love the pole saw.
customer_reviews.author: Curtis T.

customer_reviews.title: Works as intended!
customer_reviews.text: Works very well. It could use a handle of some type because bare holding the handle is a hamper on control. I can see how other have complained about the awkwardmess of ill weight distribution but being 6'4 has its advantages I guess. I cut about 30 limbs down a fencerow being 5-7" thick. Had no issues from start to finish and only dropped the battery 1 bar. I highly recommend it!
customer_reviews.author: Joseph S

customer_reviews.title: Great tool
customer_reviews.text: First of all, the instructions for tightening the chain are horrible. I love the power and that it uses the same battery as my snowblower. I was able to trim the branches on 3 trees and still had plenty of battery power remaining. It was a little heavier than I expected, but it was manageable. I also had to use a step ladder because the 8' pole wouldn't reach the branches that needed trimmed. Overall, it is a great tool to have around.
customer_reviews.author: R. Osborne

customer_reviews.title: Customer service and product failed.
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this product in April of 2020. Since then it has only worked once and I’ve contacted the customer service twice with no follow up. The one time that it did work it performed great. However, that was the only time and customer service has completely failed me in addressing the product’s failure. It seems that they have given up on supporting their customers and backing their products. I would strongly avoid purchasing their products.
customer_reviews.author: Eric Atkinson

customer_reviews.title: Gets the job done but isn’t that easy to operate
customer_reviews.text: It got the job done but was fairly hard to operate for me. The chain was always coming loose and was difficult to tighten. The directions weren’t amazing either but a few YouTube videos went a long way. Overall I like that it works with my weed eater’s 80v battery and ultimately does what I need it to do, with the acknowledgement that the difficulty in operation could easily be more user error than one of the unit’s design.
customer_reviews.author: N. Creel

customer_reviews.title: Greenworks is the best!
customer_reviews.text: This is the second battery powered saw we have purchased with the Greenworks brand. These saws are amazing! They are quiet and do a great job cutting. I have only used this saw for light tree branch trimming and it has performed well. I like the fact that you can use the saw and turn it off with the push of a button. The chargers work great and replenish the batteries in very little time. I am sold on Greenworks!
customer_reviews.author: KatyConsumer

customer_reviews.title: Self lubricating chain has major design flaw
customer_reviews.text: The pole saw works pretty well (though limited use so far) but the manufacturer should clearly indicate that the self-lunricating chain feature has a major drawback. You must empty the bar and chain oil after each use or it leaks out. I assembled our saw on the day it arrived and tried it out on a couple of small trees. I put it back in storage and retrieved it the next day to complete a larger bit of work. In ^24 hours, oil had leaked out and onto the floor and handle. Who wants to deal with this type of unnecessary mess? Unacceptable design.
customer_reviews.author: Janie S. Witte

customer_reviews.title: Great tool, terrible battery. Expensive tool for 1 year expected life.
customer_reviews.text: I like the tool, it works well, and is well-designed. The batteries are terrible though; I’ve had two fail within 15 months of buying them. I was lucky the first time and it was under warranty, but now I’m faced with throwing a lot more money at batteries that will maybe last a year (of very light use), or throwing away the hundreds of dollars’ worth of otherwise good tools that I bought.
customer_reviews.author: S. Templar

customer_reviews.title: A good HEAVY tool.
customer_reviews.text: This tool is a beast. It cuts well through oak, walnut etc. it also weighs a ton! While I love the run time - some where beyond an hour - I haven’t been run it flat yet - the limiting factor is the weight. The 80v battery is just plain heavy. Of course it was my choice to purchase the 80v version rather than the 40v so this complaint is no reflection the tool itself. On the other hand, the oil reservoir is too small and leaks while in storage. Overall a fine tool, but next time I will opt for the 40v version!
customer_reviews.author: Craig Dombey

customer_reviews.title: 80 volt GreenWorks Pole saw
customer_reviews.text: Overall, excellent pole saw. Used it to trim my 10 mesquite trees. Mesquite wood is hard, nevertheless I trimmed all the trees on just two full charges! I cut many small branches and some that were 3 inches or greater in diameter. One drawback: the saw is a bit heavy on the cutting end. I'd recommend the manufacturers of this pole saw make two modifications to perfect it: 1) place a second shoulder-strap clip a bit closer to the middle of pole for balance and for cutting lower branches 2) design a place on the saw to store wrench-screwdriver tool Other than that it's a great saw. I'd highly recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: Alberto Cantu

customer_reviews.title: Great Product...
customer_reviews.text: This is a definite 5 star rated item. Has a ton of power and cuts very quickly due to high chain speed.The 80 V battery-life is great and I highly recommend you buy this whole series from Greenworks ....
customer_reviews.author: Deryl Houser

customer_reviews.title: Gets it done!
customer_reviews.text: Great products in the series and this one does not disappoint. As this is an extension tool and needs a motor on the end, there is a balancing game you need to learn. As noted in some other reviews, be very careful when holding as it could snap. All in all great product!
customer_reviews.author: Chris

customer_reviews.title: Greenworks stuff is GREAT! This is no exception
customer_reviews.text: I've been replacing all of my 2-stroke yard stuff with Greenworks Pro series. Have been using Mower, Blower and String Trimmer for 6 months and couldn't be happier!! Comes on when you want it to, no "will it start and how many times do I have to pull the string" stress. This saw is no different. Just got it and trimmed my giant apple tree in minutes!! I hope someday EVERYBODY (especially gardeners) start using electric. Would sure keep my neighborhood quieter!
customer_reviews.author: Tim Jones

customer_reviews.title: nice and quiet. I prefer it to gas models.
customer_reviews.text: works very nice. It will cut thru limbs as big as the bar no problems. Quiet and battery holds charge for long time. Draw back is its alittle hard to balance but it is acceptable. If they ever made a telescoping model it would be ideal. It will give you a work out using it but I am happy w its preformance.
customer_reviews.author: darryl crosby

customer_reviews.title: Powerful and durable
customer_reviews.text: This tool is a powerhouse and indispensable for cleaning up fence lines on the farm. I tested its ability to cut larger branches--six inches or better. It passed with flying colors. In one session, by the time I wore down the battery I had four 12 ft. trailer loads of branches to haul away. It took a while for the chain to stretch and stabilize. I recommend this pole saw for anyone who has a lot of trees to trim.
customer_reviews.author: Tim

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for what I need
customer_reviews.text: I like the ease of use. No gas/oil to mix. No problems with engine starting. Just take it down and get to work. It does a great job at cleaning up small trees, trimming older trees. There is plenty of power, and in my opinion it cuts as good as a gas powered chain saw. The only issue I have is the weight. I'm 73 years old and it is a little heavy for me, but the shoulder strap does make it easier. I gave it 4 stars for ease of use only because of the weight. I do like it and would repurchase.
customer_reviews.author: Jack

customer_reviews.title: good value for the money
customer_reviews.text: the saw is easy to put together, battery came fully charged, and what an impressive charger. everything looks well made. first job pruning an oak tree, found the balance between handle and blade good. the saw cut 4" limbs surprisingly easy.
customer_reviews.author: larry f.

customer_reviews.title: Powerful
customer_reviews.text: Oh man I did not expect this thing to be so powerful and the run time was amazing. I trimmed so many apple trees and it still had power. It charges in 30 min. I cut through very thick branches with no problem. I would recommend this product.
customer_reviews.author: laura

customer_reviews.title: DO NOT WASTE YOUR MONEY!!!
customer_reviews.text: This pole saw leaked oil form the first time I used it and never stopped leaking. Shortly after using it a few times the battery would not take a charge. It looks serious but looks can be deceiving. I'm so disappointed in spending so much and not being able to use this product. Go with Ego, much more reliable!
customer_reviews.author: Mark G.

customer_reviews.title: NICE Product & Very strong for a cordless tool.
customer_reviews.text: VERY good product. Surprising power and length of battery time. We have two batteries and just pop one on, then the other is ready almost as fast as needed. We are going to order more of this brand. Strongest cordless we have seen and worth the cost. My husband loves it and even I (wife) can use it comfortably. Comes with a shoulder strap which helps too. Battery is pretty darn heavy, but once locked in, it actually balances the saw, so it is easy to move around.
customer_reviews.author: Emily K Mathews

customer_reviews.title: Good Chainsaw
customer_reviews.text: I like this little 10 foot pole saw. It doesn't have the power of a conventional combustion saw but it gets the job done. And it is much lighter than a conventional chainsaw. It is much quieter and not as stinky as regular chainsaws are. All in all a great little tool to do light pruning in my fruit trees and other tall trees. I like Greenworks and the two products of their's that I own. Also nice that I can interchange the batteries from the different equipment. And maybe I'm not polluting as much either.
customer_reviews.author: roger

customer_reviews.title: Returned
customer_reviews.text: Too much plastic. Plastic gears. Durability lacking. Difficult to handle in field because of hand positioning needed to operate safety features and still cut. Disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Vermont Reader

customer_reviews.title: It cuts like a hot knife through Butter.
customer_reviews.text: This is a great tool. I found it to be a little on the heavy side at the blade but that weight helped cut those pesky straggler bottom branches evenly & quickly. I had an old hand pole saw and was leery at first to get a powered saw because 2 strokes are so smelly & noisy. This 80 Volt Electric model did the best of both worlds. It's very fast, sharp, odorless and quiet
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Lots of power and battery life
customer_reviews.text: Great tool. Have cut about 80 limbs with no problems. Power is amazing. Battery life outstanding. Battery charges quickly and intelligently. (Charger stops when battery fully charged). Does exactly what I wanted it for. The unit gets a little heavy after a while. I find having a helper to alternate cutting chores helps with our fatigue. Even when two of us trade turns cutting, the battery has more stamina than two of us.
customer_reviews.author: Don Beahm

customer_reviews.title: Extremely  heavy
customer_reviews.text: The weight of blade end is extremely heavier than expected. Poor design when blad end seems heavier than battery. At least battery end has a strap
customer_reviews.author: PA

customer_reviews.title: Great power and wonderful convenience of rechargeables
customer_reviews.text: This pole saw has a lot of power and is very convenient with its battery--no more dealing with gasoline and pull-starting. And it does a great job with medium size projects around the yard. My yard guy loves it. That being said, it should be noted that the battery is heavy thus making the pole saw heavy while operating. The advantage is that the weight is at the bottom of the pole where the battery is located.
customer_reviews.author: R F Barchiesi

customer_reviews.title: HEAVY
customer_reviews.text: This thing is a beast. Lasts forever. Really powerful. But it is HEAVY!!!!!! It gave me my first ever case (in 50 years) of "golfers elbow." Excruciating. I couldn't figure out how to use the harness to take the weight off my left (front) arm. I've been paying the price for about 3 months now. Trying to think of some modifications I can do on the harness to take the heat off my arm when the next time rolls around. Thankful for winter.
customer_reviews.author: David Summers

customer_reviews.title: 80v System gives you plenty of power. Saw cuts very well. THEN IT BROKE AND I CAN"T GET PARTS
customer_reviews.text: I use this for light work around the garden. It seems well made and the saw cuts branches up to 2-3 in diameter quite nicely. The pole enables me to reach higher in to trees without needing to get on a ladder. Update: the C-clip that holds the gear that moves the chain broke, along with the washers to keep everything together. Now I can't get a response from them for parts.
customer_reviews.author: NH

customer_reviews.title: very nice
customer_reviews.text: This thing works perfectly so far, I've only used it a couple of times, but it works great.
customer_reviews.author: Larry Grace

customer_reviews.title: Terrible manufacturer assistance...
customer_reviews.text: Impossible to get chain replacement. Manufacturer does not reply e-mails. Any one knows where I can buy the correct chain replacement?
customer_reviews.author: Pablo Páramo-Sierra

customer_reviews.title: It's a keeper
customer_reviews.text: Easy to set up and operate. Used one time to trim 10-12 2-4" limbs in yard. It cuts fantastic. Yes it is on the heavy side with the motor on the end, but that can be an advantage. The weight of the saw on the limb allows it to cut quickly through the limb. If it has long battery life, I may sell the 2-cycle limb cutter. And consider buying a battery operated chain saw.
customer_reviews.author: JRC2

customer_reviews.title: Cuts very good. Fast charge
customer_reviews.text: Cuts very good. Fast charge. Not clear how to get a spare chain. Apparently the 10" chain for the standard chainsaw does not fit the polesaw 80V.
customer_reviews.author: Stephen McCarthy

customer_reviews.title: Stay away. Hunk of junk.
customer_reviews.text: Cheap Chinese poopoo. Weak motor. Poor ergonomics. Warranty is a joke. Company is trash. Stay away. Many better options out there.
customer_reviews.author: Max G.

customer_reviews.title: I wasted my money
customer_reviews.text: I used the saw about an hour last fall and put the battery on the charger for storage over the winter. When spring came I found the battery was dead. They want over $100.00 for a replacement. I will just rent one from Home Depot when I need to cut again.
customer_reviews.author: laurence

customer_reviews.title: Love it so far
customer_reviews.text: So far I love it, Cuts through anything so fast and with the 80 volt you can get the whole job done , great:)
customer_reviews.author: John Augustine

customer_reviews.title: Excellent pole saw
customer_reviews.text: Of course, all pole saws are a physical challenge. I must say that the battery electric is much better than working with a gas pole saw. This saw works well and the battery life is good. It is very powerful for an electric saw. Do not order the chain that Amazon suggests as a "bundled" purchase. It does not fit this saw. I went to the local saw shop and they made up a second chain for the saw.
customer_reviews.author: Tracy G.

customer_reviews.title: greenworks personal are great
customer_reviews.text: when I got it the battery was no good so I called greenworks up and they were great they sent me a new one and it only took 3 day when they told me 5 to 10 days. when I was on phone with them they were really nice and truly did care
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: customer support
customer_reviews.text: This product arrived over a week ago and was missing the chain oil reserve cap. I tried to contact their product support to have them send me one but there has been no response. Their hotline has at least a 2 hour wait and their e-mail just has an auto reply. If nothing happens the next 2 days I'm just going to return it and give up.
customer_reviews.author: SHARLEEN

customer_reviews.title: Cuts through limbs like they weren't there
customer_reviews.text: Could be best tool I ever purchased. It is a bit heavy but comes with support strap. I have used on limbs up to five inches and burns right through them.
customer_reviews.author: R.D.

customer_reviews.title: It's a good choice for the money!
customer_reviews.text: This was a Father's Day gift to my husband. I looked at least 5 or 6 different Battery operated pruners before ordering this one. I asked several other Male friends what they thought & all said that was the best buy!
customer_reviews.author: LaVonne. A  Doty

customer_reviews.title: Buy a saw with reasonably-priced commonly-replaced parts!
customer_reviews.text: The 80 volt pole saw cuts great and the battery lasts well. However, when you need a new chain, you have to buy a new bar and a new chain at $40.00 plus. The help number is of no help. Buy a different saw!
customer_reviews.author: Principal Reader

customer_reviews.title: Powerful but too long for every application
customer_reviews.text: This is a beast of a saw especially one powered by battery. The reach is simultaneously a good and bad thing. It would be nice if the pole could be shortened. It is very cumbersome to use when low pruning is needed. One must stand far away to cut with it. I actually bought the 40 volt too, so I’d have a shorter saw.
customer_reviews.author: Alan Hunt

customer_reviews.title: 14 days, was promised replacement in 5. Returning this item. Avoid Greenworks tools.
customer_reviews.text: Delivered with defective battery the day after I ordered. Called the contact #, spoke w tech who diagnosed defective battery, said replacement would be here within 5 days. It’s now been 11 days, no battery, Sunday before Christmas, have to hope to speak w someone on Christmas Eve. Now going on 2 weeks and I haven’t been able to use the saw, no idea how well it will work. Seems to be heavy but well balanced, I really would like to know how well it cuts.
customer_reviews.author: Lowell Grant

customer_reviews.title: Works great
customer_reviews.text: Works great but the metal guard keeps slipping and destroyed the first trimmer I bought, so I bought another one and will keep the first for parts.
customer_reviews.author: Deborah J Vessey

customer_reviews.title: Cuts limbs as good as a gas trimmer.
customer_reviews.text: Cuts good, battery life is good, the only negative is that it's a little heavy.
customer_reviews.author: Ron R.

customer_reviews.title: Response from manufacturer was terrible still waiting for a ship date on new battery
customer_reviews.text: When I got this item the battery was dead I placed it on the charger because it immediately came up red which is a sign of a bad battery . When we called the company they checked the numbers on the shipping package and told us the battery was 3 years old which really concerns me about how old the item is .
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great tool
customer_reviews.text: Love this saw. I have a bad shoulder, so I was worried I wouldn’t be able to use this saw. Good news is that I can. Battery lasts long enough to get a lot of work done. Much better tool than I expected.
customer_reviews.author: Jim

customer_reviews.title: Good with flaws
customer_reviews.text: Pros: Great power, great battery life. Cons: Uses obscure 58 link chain which is hard to get Poor balance. Strap needs to be attached further forward closer to the CG. It's way in the back which makes it almost useless.
customer_reviews.author: Tone Loco

customer_reviews.title: The new battery is defective and will not charge.
customer_reviews.text: The new battery is defective and will not charge. I've had to go to the customer service phone number, get transferred around and order a new one, but I still don't know when it will arrive. Not good.
customer_reviews.author: lyn Wright

customer_reviews.title: Dead on arrival
customer_reviews.text: Battery won't charge. Returning for a replacement. Hoping I'll have better luck with the replacement.
customer_reviews.author: Gilbert A. Rangel

customer_reviews.title: Received the unit but the battery would not charge
customer_reviews.text: Unit seems to be well made but unable to use! The charger is blinking red. I called the factory as in the instructions. I went through the trouble shoot on the phone. They determined the charger is the issue. Well I received the charger and the new charger blinks red. I just ordered a new battery which will arrive in a day. Hopefully either of the chargers work with the new battery. If so then I will contact the factory and work out the details. I am not waiting ten days for another shipment to find out the problem. If this does not work I will return the lot.
customer_reviews.author: george hauck

customer_reviews.title: Buyer beware
customer_reviews.text: Buyer beware. Replacement chain costs over $45 from Greenworks because they make you buy a new bar with it. Finding replacement chain only is a nightmare. Finally found a source at over $25 plus shipping for chain only.
customer_reviews.author: M. I. Binswanger

customer_reviews.title: Works great 👍🏾
customer_reviews.text: Works great 👍🏾 I have been using it a lot and I’ve had no problems. The battery life is great. I can limb all day. Easily cuts through large limbs. I have 17 ac on a lake in Maine and this saw has been a real asset.
customer_reviews.author: Steve

customer_reviews.title: Good saw ..
customer_reviews.text: The saw gets jammed to easily.. Needs to reject debris better
customer_reviews.author: PhaTz

customer_reviews.title: Battery AND charger for battery not included.
customer_reviews.text: Leaving a 3 until I actually use it. Probabably works great. Frustration is not that it doesn’t clearly say “battery not included”, but rather should say, “battery not included and charger is sold separately from battery”. It’s another $153 on top of what I paid. To be fair it can be used with a lot of other stuff, but still...
customer_reviews.author: S.H.

customer_reviews.title: Battery isn’t working
customer_reviews.text: Battery is DOA The battery I received is not working, at all.Pretty sure I read that this is a common problem. Hopefully Greenworks makes this right. Support is until 5PM EST for US customers?
customer_reviews.author: Josh Shields

customer_reviews.title: This is amazing! It cut through 3-4 inch limbs like butter
customer_reviews.text: This is amazing! It cut through 3-4 inch limbs like butter. I never have to worry about spark plugs, bad gas, you pull the trigger and it works. The only thing to make it better would be if it picked up and disposed of the limbs after!!!! Totally worth the price.
customer_reviews.author: M. Deering

customer_reviews.title: Works as well as gas
customer_reviews.text: I have several greenworks 80v products and I really like them. They feel as powerful as gas models and are way easier to start and keep going. I trimmed all of the trees in my yard on a single charge.
customer_reviews.author: Yang

customer_reviews.title: This is a winner
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for my son as a gift. He is delighted. This is easy to use and does the job. It’s sturdy yet lightweight. I had to buy my husband one because he was jealous.
customer_reviews.author: Joyce K.

customer_reviews.title: Don't buy
customer_reviews.text: You can not buy just a replacement chain. Have to pay $40 for a kit with a bar. I don't need a bar.
customer_reviews.author: Shiba's

customer_reviews.title: Good and greasy :-)
customer_reviews.text: Cuts through branches with ease, plenty of power, easy to handle. SLINGS bar and chain oil though. It would be nice if it was a bit more conservative in chain oil consumption.
customer_reviews.author: M. Vallier

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Nice electric saw that is very sharp and powerful. Better than my gasoline version.
customer_reviews.author: Thomas H

customer_reviews.title: Watch out trees!
customer_reviews.text: This is a great product and has worked really well! All 80V greenworks tools have impressed me so far and this one has def performed.
customer_reviews.author: Hodge721

customer_reviews.title: the bar with chain was backwards
customer_reviews.text: It was backwards once that was fixed it was great
customer_reviews.author: Paul G. Thoele

customer_reviews.title: works great
customer_reviews.text: no complaints...works well. Was a lightening deal and I needed another battery for my snow blower. I am impressed with the power. At times it does feel heavy but not bad.
customer_reviews.author: George T.

customer_reviews.title: Very powerful
customer_reviews.text: Was worried this battery powered saw would be under powered, but this thing cuts through big branches (5-10 inch diameter) with ease. Very happy with this saw!
customer_reviews.author: ABQreviewer

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed
customer_reviews.text: Hasn’t even been a year and the battery is shot and there is no customer service. Should’ve went with stihl right away.
customer_reviews.author: Taylor Henry

customer_reviews.title: Pleasant surprise
customer_reviews.text: I had my doubts about a battery powered saw. This polesaw is wonderful. Battery life is great. Charges in 30 minutes.
customer_reviews.author: William C. Hendren

customer_reviews.title: It was great
customer_reviews.text: The saw was great, the only thing I didn’t like was the chain kept coming off. It made for a long day of cutting branches.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: It is very easy to operate and works as well or better that ...
customer_reviews.text: It is very easy to operate and works as well or better that any gas powered chain saw I have ever used.
customer_reviews.author: Kenneth P. Reese

customer_reviews.title: This is a GREAT TOOL!!
customer_reviews.text: While it is heavy and sometimes difficult to manouver, it is quite powerful and gets the job done consistently! I highly recommend it to anyone who needs a tool like this!!
customer_reviews.author: Michael Reece

customer_reviews.title: Works great
customer_reviews.text: The pole saw worked as advertised, making generally quick work of a lot of low hanging branches on many trees. It is somewhat heavy with the big battery so I had to take quite a few breaks. The battery also held up well.
customer_reviews.author: Kevin O.

customer_reviews.title: Definitely recommend!
customer_reviews.text: Cuts surprisingly fast and handles 2-3” limbs with ease. Really surprised how nice this works.
customer_reviews.author: Daniel Stewart

customer_reviews.title: Great product for rural areas.
customer_reviews.text: This here is a must have. Cuts really fast. Gets into high places.
customer_reviews.author: Bob

customer_reviews.title: Not a telescoping pole cutter
customer_reviews.text: This ia a great product. I have the 80 volt lawn mower too. Does what it says.
customer_reviews.author: Madalynne

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Cuts wood fast and the extension pole allows you to stay on the ground to cut branches.
customer_reviews.author: Joel

customer_reviews.title: Very useful tool
customer_reviews.text: We have been very well pleased with this polesaw. It makes quick work of overhanging branches.
customer_reviews.author: Carol Laube

customer_reviews.title: Battery life is very impressive and it only tKes 30 minutes to recharge.
customer_reviews.text: Very impressed with this pole saw. 1st time i used it trimed trees in the yard. Cut about 50 branches ranging from 1 to 4 inches and the saw powered through them with ease. The largest branch was 8 inches and still went right thorough it. When I was done the battery still had 2 of the 3 lights lite up. Highly recommended!
customer_reviews.author: Jodi Baumgartner

customer_reviews.title: Cuts like a gas Chainsaw
customer_reviews.text: Cuts through 6-7 inch diameter branches like butter. Only negitive is weight. I am 73 and holding this high up is tough.
customer_reviews.author: Thomas Kelly

customer_reviews.title: Work great
customer_reviews.text: We have a ranch and my husband wanted to use something with a battery instead of gas. This works great. So great we bought the regular saw also.
customer_reviews.author: Susie

customer_reviews.title: Great Saw
customer_reviews.text: I was reluctant to purchase this saw but glad I did I run this about 3hrs still half charged . I seriously think about chainsaw in the near future.
customer_reviews.author: REB

customer_reviews.title: Unadjustable pole length and messy chain oil.
customer_reviews.text: I do not like the fact that the pole is not adjustable, it has to always be used at full length. Also the chain oil runs down the pole providing a messy grip. Battery lasted one hour.
customer_reviews.author: Jim Thompson

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Good saw, good price. It is heavy so if you are not strong you should get s lighter one.
customer_reviews.author: Ron

customer_reviews.title: Very long lasting batteru
customer_reviews.text: This was a great saw. I trimmed the the trees in the yard in one charge. The battery still has more than 1/2 charge.
customer_reviews.author: Fireman Peak

customer_reviews.title: Does the job
customer_reviews.text: Really cuts through limbs easily, very impressed. BUT it's very, very heavy and awkward
customer_reviews.author: Ronald S.

product_meta.title: Greenworks PRO 80V 10” Brushless Cordless Polesaw, 2.0Ah Battery and Charger Included PS80L210
product_meta.description: Style:2Ah Battery IncludedLandscaping has never been easier with Greenworks PRO 80V max system. the most powerful cordless battery platform in outdoor power equipment, you can now breeze through homes, corporate parks & entertainment venues with zero gas, zero emission & zero maintenance. Go from zero to power with a push of a button & get you through the task at hand with less vibration, less noise & less mess. With additional batteries, a rapid charger for quick charge time & a multiple tool compatibility platform, you can get all your landscaping done with all the power & performance of gas while at a lower cost of operation. it's not just your job, it's your life. Auto oiler and translucent oil tank
feature_bullets: 10” Bar and Chain. High Performance 1/4" Chain For Quick Cutting
Brushless Motor Provides More Torque, Quiet Operation, and Longer Life
Automatic Oiler Applies Oil To The Bar and Chain For Continuous Lubrication
(Replacement Chain: 2937002). Use Greenworks GWSH0 Chainsaw Safety Helmet For Added Protection

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.3 out of 5 stars321 ratings4.3 out of 5 stars
